title: Frank Lampard says Christian Pulisic deserves a Chelsea starting place
text:
Frank Lampard says Christian Pulisic deserves a place in the Chelsea starting line-up following his impact from the bench of late - but hinted the American may have to be patient.

The £58million winger has started just one match for Chelsea since the end of August and that was against League Two Grimsby Town in the Carabao Cup.

And following his last Premier League start - in the 2-2 draw with Sheffield United on August 31 - he has been named as a substitute in five consecutive league fixtures.

Christian Pulisic made a positive impression off the bench as Chelsea won 1-0 away to Ajax

The £58million American winger has had to be patient in waiting for his chance to play

However, the 21-year-old impressed from the bench in Wednesday's 1-0 Champions League win over Ajax, setting up Michy Batshuayi for the decisive goal.

'There way he's played he deserves a starting place regularly in the last few weeks, but so do others and that's what I keep saying is the nice problem that I have,' Lampard said ahead of Saturday's visit to Burnley.

'But it's brilliant that he's coming on and making the impact that he's making and of course he'll get his starts, that's the reason he's come here.

'But we've got Callum Hudson-Odoi, who was top class against Newcastle last week at home, in terms of creation, Willian, I think I declared him our best player in the great patch we had of four-or-five games.

Manager Frank Lampard has told suggested that Pulisic will get his opportunity to start games

Pulisic will hope to start for Chelsea when they travel to Burnley on Saturday evening

'So they're good options for me and Christian is getting stronger and he's getting more in the group.

'With players that come here and some of them you have to give them a bit of time, particularly young players, but he's playing well, so he's certainly in strong contention.'

Chelsea have won their last six matches in all competitions and have moved into the top four of the table ahead of their trip to Turf Moor.

Pulisic, who signed from Borussia Dortmund in January but made the move to Chelsea over the summer, has contributed five assists in nine outings so far.
